Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 09:22AM Mindyandgang wrote: J45 have you received your results? I don't know you but I am still checking everyday and praying your results come back B9! Also to the all in this topic I have a question, I have not seen a BS just my OB and the surgeon along with the mammo and ultrasound but nobody ever checked my nodes under my armpits they only checked the area where the lump is. Is this normal? Or does it even matter, I guess it will all go back to path results.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 04:59PM Mindyandgang wrote: RachelHH from what I understand it's called a "wire guided" biopsy mine will go in the 2 o'clock position in my breast, but I don't understand why they need a guide, you can easily feel my lump. I am a small breasted woman so there isn't a lot to feel through. Just a B cup. Also they drew a purple circle around the lump and asked me to mark it if it wears off before next Thursday. So I told my hubby he has permission to draw circles on my boobie for the time being. I know nothing is funny about any of this but it gave us a lol.
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 05:18PM Mindyandgang wrote: Mishka, I did not have a needle biopsy, they decided to go straight to the lumpectomy with wire localization. I am scheduled for a miraluma scan tomorrow morning, meet with the biopsy tech, and hopefully do my pre-op tomorrow and surgery scheduled for Thursday morning. I have to say that every time I see "the nice man/lady with the IV/pill I have to smile! Too cute! RachelHH I am glad you mentioned sports bra because I do not have one I use underwire bras and I will purchase a sports bra tomorrow. Anything that will make recovery easier will be a great help. I have told my mother, father, mother-in-law, and my best friend. My mom and MIL are coming for surgery and both live two hours away. MIL is staying for a few days after because my mom has to work. Also my best friend lives five hours away but called and offered to come also. I was so touched by that but told her that because I probably won't know anything I felt she didn't need to come. I can never say it enough that it means so much to me that you all take the time to give me details about your situations so I can kind of know what to expect! I will be on here as often as I can no matter what my results are just to let you all know that there are people that care and want everything to go well for you all also! It does not matter if we don't know the people we speak to on here personally but it is the fact that we all have the same worries in common. Strange how you never know how it feels until you are in the situation yourself. Much love and prayers to all that read this!

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2012 03:21PM Mindyandgang wrote: Mishka, they took my drain out but I wish they would have left it I am already getting a huge bruise and I am not one to bruise easily. It's kind of strange though because I have a lot of swelling so I have one breast two times the size of the other. I slept a lot yesterday thanks to the nice man! I think his face is the only face I would recognize if I saw him today! I don't know exactly what he gave me but I slept from 2:00 yesterday until midnight in my recliner in the living room my kids were running around, studying,watching tv full blast and doing their homework and I never even heard them!! Thanks to my mom and their dad I didn't have to worry about them. But I still can't believe I never heard a thing! They told me I should get my results Monday or Tuesday so, i hope we both get our results Monday and that they are B9! I still wish the Dr. Would at least have told me that it looked like a typical fibroadenoma maybe it would have at least made me feel better. It's going to be a long weekend:(

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 07:50PM Mindyandgang wrote: Anne----thank you for telling me about your experience, the only thing I do know is that they will be doing my wire localization via ultrasound. I hope that will be better for me as far as comfort. I am pleased to know that I am getting a lot of input on my situation it seems to make me feel a little more at ease knowing what to expect. If you don't mind me asking, how did they find your LCIS? Was it in an abnormal mammo? I know that it is not always easily detectable. Did you have to go through any treatment? I am just asking out of concern because I read that it is not a real cancer but it can cause cancer in the future. It must be hard wondering every time you go for a checkup will it be something worse:( I pray that you never have to go through anything more than what you have gone through already. If I am wrong on the info I have on LCIS feel free to correct me. There is so much I am learning about different breast conditions and am willing to listen to whatever anyone has to tell me! Wishing the best for you always! Mindy
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2012 09:09PM Mindyandgang wrote: Hi Mishka and all others who have been following my progress. I did my miraluma scan today. It was not a very comfortable test but it is over now. They gave me a radioactive shot and sat me in a chair. It was similar to a mammo but I was able to sit in a chair. 4 photos were taken on each breast but you have to sit with your breast compressed (like mammo) for eight minutes for Each photo. Having your boobs squashed is uncomfortable enough but to sit like that for 8 mins for one photo was beyond uncomfortable. Well, after the first eight,the radiologist said he thought he saw a spot in my other breast and wanted a repeat of all of the photos UGH!!! So I figured out that my poor boobies were squashed for a total of 128 minutes!!! First the good thing is that the second lump he found did not show up on the repeat images very well,so there is not alot of blood flow to that lump. BUT, the original lump showed blood flow on all the images. Also, the node in the breast that has the mass was lit up with a lot of blood flow and the node in the breast without the lump was not. I asked the tech about it and she said maybe I have an infection somewhere that I don't know about. I know that it could be possible, but my gut feeling is that she told me that to make me feel better. It seems that it is more than just a coincidence that the node in the breast with the mass is showing something but the breast with no mass the nodes are clear. There is nothing I can do but wait until my lumpectomy Thursday, the Dr. may give me a hint as to what it looks like but I will have to wait until next week for confirmation from pathology. Again I send so much love and prayers to all of you who are going through these hard times with me. It is a great thing that we can have support from others in the same situation We are in and my heart goes out to those who are having even more worries than me. these message boards are a wonderful thing a person can have because we want to be strong for our family but here we can pour our hearts out and know that we all understand what each other are going through! God Bless all of you strong women out there! Together we WILL stand strong and be there for each other when we just need to vent, cry or just try to understand. Until next time,....Mindy!
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2012 02:13AM Mindyandgang wrote: Hello! I had my biopsy today I guess it wasn't too bad. The morning started with a mammo guided wire localization. A little uncomfortable because I was sore from miraluma scan yesterday. I was taken to surgery woke up , ( I don't know how long it took) I have a four inch incision a bit sore and quite swollen slept all afternoon now I have a low grade fever. I guess that's usual. My mom spoke to the dr. And asked him what it looked like ans the surgeon told her he won't go there we will have to wait for pathology. This kindly aggravated me I wouldhaverathered him say it looked b9 but we will have to see. That is what he had told me when he had first seen the scan. Oh well now it's the wait and see gamy.....again:(

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2012 06:20PM Mindyandgang wrote: Hi Mishka and RachelHH! Rachel, I am glad to hear that things seem to be going a little better for you, and Mishka, I will continue to pray that things turn out well for you also. I can not tell all of you how much I am humbled to know that you all have been here for me and we know that we can be here for each other without even having to actually know each other( does that even make sense lmbo) it is actually hard for me to tell any of you something like "I'm glad that you are healed and everything is all better" because I feel that having gone through this experience we ALL will never be the same. It is so sad to know that people can't actually relate to others with breast issues until you are there yourself. It doesn't matter how much you hear about breast cancer awareness it just isn't the same until you,or another family member has to deal with the situation. I love you all from the bottom of my heart and I will NEVER forget the kindness you all have shown me. NOW, I can tell you my path results. I have not met with the Dr. For my follow-up but I read my path results and I did see B9! I don't quite understand all of what it says but from what I gather I think I will be OK. My path results say Phyllodes of breast,Benign with prominent myxoid stromal component. Adjacent breast tissue showing fibrocystic changes with periductal sclerosis,apocrine metaplasia,lobular sclerosis and early breast cyst formation. So, I understand benign phyllodes but the rest is Greek to me! I guess the surgeon will explain. But, from what I understand phyllodes are very rare, so if I can get that then why can't I win the lottery????
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2012 11:34PM Mindyandgang wrote: I am praying that you get good news all the way around! When do you go for you re excision? I am feeling better every day, still am unable to lift my arm up too high, still some swelling, but the incision was quite a big larger that expected. I will find out why when I meet with the surgeon. I was still out when he spoke to my family after surgery and they didn't know what questions to ask. I have about half my ta-ta bruised but I expected that. Just be sure to pamper YOUR ta-ta's for now since it seems that you still have more bruises to come! I will let you know as soon as I hear something. I have a feeling It is going to get the best of me tomorrow and I will probably call the pathologist tomorrow just to see if there is a chance they have my results in. Unless I find something to keep me very busy I think it is going to drive me crazy! In need of the nice man about right now! I think it's time for me to take a Xanax and just try to get some sleep for tonight.
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2012 11:45AM Mindyandgang wrote: Mishka, I am honored to send my prayers! Look on the Internet and there is a girl named Charlene Richard. She is said to have performed miracles. unsolved mysteries even did a episode on her about a girl who had leukemia and was told she would not survive. Anyway the girls family and friends prayed to Charlene and lived. I live two miles from Charlene's grave and I put prayers in the petition box at her grave for anyone who requests it or for people I feel need prayers. I know a lot of people feel funny about talking about religion, but I believe in this little girls miracles. My incision also is on my left breast, left side about 4-5 inches from my nipple so it is quite uncomfortable to try wearing any bra because of the straps. I do have a bra that I have been wearing sometimes though it's a stretch cotton but there are no shoulder straps I just step in it and pull it up no trying to put my arms in or any clips. Basically it's like a strapless sports bra. I am so glad there is nothing big going on right now because I am the type of person who wants to be there and do everything with my children also. My daughter had her last volleyball game of the season the night before surgery so I was able to attend and my 5 and seven year old only need help with homework in the afternoon but my daughter (15) has been helping with that and my husband and 19 year old son have been doing the errands and driving. It is driving me crazy not calling the pathologist to see if they have my results. I know i will cave in and call today but I am going to try my best to wait until this afternoon even though they told me to call Tuesday. All they can do is either say they have them or not.
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2012 10:25AM Mindyandgang wrote: Karen, if you could change the color black for purple and add a little orange on your breast it would be nice if a pot of gold grew in there instead of cancer? Haha here's to wishing. Also, the amazing sisterhood I have gained here will always be remembered. I know I could talk to my family and friends here about what I feel, but I just did not want to bother them with the repetitive talk. Even though we all know that in this situation it seems that our minds are thinking about what is going on in our bodies 24 hours a day. When I talked to the nurse practitioner at my OB office yesterday, she told me that even though my tumor is b9 I will have breast problems probably for the rest of my life and need biopsies because the growths I will probably get can't be determined non-cancerous by mammo or ultrasound without biopsy:( still wondering what the surgeon will say. Besides the phylloyd, I have lobular sclerosis, periductal sclerosis, and apocrine metaplasia in the adjacent breast tissue and my other breast basically from what I understand all of these things will cause growths that can only be ruled non cancerous by doing a biopsy. The funny thing is that except when I had my children, I have been a very small breasted woman it has just been since I turned 40 that my breast started to fill out. I always wished I could have more up there but now....well, I guess you've heard the expression be careful what you wish for?

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2012 11:52PM Mindyandgang wrote: RachelHH I hope you get your results before the weekend! I know that my surgeon said that he thinks it's B9 but he also told me that he has seen many cases that looked B9 and weren't. The only thing that bothered me was that I had a mammo and a ultrasound yesterday and he never even looked at them! He read the report that had the findings that I had written above but never looked at the films. I was bothered by that but later thought about it and realized that no matter what, the outcome will be the same. Lumpectomy in one week and probably another week b4 path results are in. BTW he said the chances of it being b9 are about 80%. Good luck and I hope to hear good news from you soon! Thinking Positive, Mindy!
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 08:44PM Mindyandgang wrote: RachelHH! Papilloma is B9 !!! I am doing the B9 happy dance for you!!!! I hope to be doing the happy dance here within the next two weeks. (wow that seems so long when it's written) surgery is next Thurs. I spoke to the biopsy tech today and she said because my surgery is on Thursday I would probably not get my results until the following Tuesday or Wednesday. I do have to say that the Dr.s I have been to have been more comforting than I can imagine. I found the lump last Thursday, seen OB Tuesday,mammo and ultrasound Wednesday,Surgeon Thursday and am scheduled for my lumpectomy next Thursday. I even received calls from my OB, the surgeons office, the hospital, and the person in charge of the biopsy all today! All were making sure my progress was going smoothly and checking to make sure I have all of my reports and things before I go into surgery so things can go quick. I am so humbled by all of the support I am getting in this situation including all of you who have taken time out of your lives to speak to me. Even if my test comes out B9 I think I will always come back to this site on a daily basis just to keep up with everyone's progress and try to lend an ear to anybody who needs! I am so lucky with the care that I am getting from my Dr.'s because it seems that most of you have to wait a lot longer than I will have to wait and my heart goes to all of you who have to worry for such a long time b4 you get answers.
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2012 12:42AM Mindyandgang wrote: Wow hematoma is still there after that long! Also, a hematoma can cause the area to feel hard. I hope they don't go in the same area on the biopsy tomorrow. I know they will numb the area but have you thought about taking something else for pain also? Even if it's a couple of Tylenol or 600-800 mg of ibuprofen. What mg of Xanax do you take? I have been on many different dosages of Xanax on and off for the past 20 yrs. the smallest dose was .25 mg but I have had a 2 mg Xanax before. I take it myself now but my dose is 1 mg but I know I could take 2 if needed but 2mg makes me too sleepy (maybe that would be nice if you could snooze during the process! lol) I will definitely say a prayer for you tonight and will be thinking of you tomorrow morning and hope everything will go well for you. I will be at the hospital at 7:00 am tomorrow doing my pre op for Thursday. BTW I sure hope they don't have any reason to do any boobie squashing on you until the hematoma clears up because that would be even more unpleasant for even one minute! Hell, if I had known just what they were going to do for my test today I would have taken my Xanax AND a lortab or a 800 mg ibuprofen tablet this morning but I had expected it to be more like a MRI the worst I expected was the shot of the radio active substance. Now I know if I ever have to do that again i WILL take something for my nerves and the discomfort. The lady was nice but not THAT nice lol. Good luck tomorrow and I am sending hugs your way. Be sure to let me know how it goes....Mindy

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 12:01PM Mindyandgang wrote: Mishka, I think I am going to like the nice man with the IV! I am not feeling bad about surgery because I am terribly terrified of a needle going into my breast while I am awake! I know they will numb the area but it is just the idea of it. In fact the surgeon called this morning and told me that I have to have a ultrasound at 7am the morning of the surgery and they are going to put a needle in the breast to pinpoint the area the Dr. Will cut so he can cut the least amount of surrounding tissue as possible. Has anyone heard of this? Needle guided surgery??? The countdown begins. I just want this over with no matter the results, I want to know! Love to all of you strong women! P.S. I am keeping this from most of my family I told my husband,mother and mother-in-law. I know my 19 year old and my 14 yr. old will understand but what do I tell my 5 and 7 yr. old boys when they ask why I had surgery. Also I need to talk to my 14 yr. old daughter because she is large breasted. Not only do I have this scare but her great grandmother on her dads side had a mastectomy for breast cancer. She needs to learn to check her breasts. It's bad enough that she had a D cup at 13 years old before any of the other girls but now she will always have to be cautious:(

I am so glad that they will numb the area first and I hope I have a nice person there to give me a chill pill. Lol. I did tell my 19 and 15 year old children because I will need their help getting the little ones off to school Thursday when I have surgery. Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2012 02:55PM Mindyandgang wrote: Hi Mishka! I am glad that things went well for you this morning! I don't blame you for asking for double the numbing meds. The least amount of pain the better. It amazes me how sensitive the breast area is. I feel like I got in a fight today and that's just from the scan I did yesterday. I already have bruises showing up. Today's pre-op was the same as any typical surgery, blood test,EKG,sign a stack of papers,you know all that fun stuff,orders for tomorrow no solid food after 8pm,clear fluids til midnight and be at the hospital for 5:30am. I consider myself as a strong person that can tolerate pain well,but I am not so sure about this time considering how sore I am just from yesterday. I am no stranger to surgeries, I have been through a lot in my life, last year I had a hysterectomy, I had to have my gallbladder removed, two childbirths all natural, two c-sections(ten pound babies) and I have had 14 knee surgeries due to a motorcycle accident when I was 19 (I was a passenger, we were run off the road into a concrete barrier then my legs were run over by the truck behind us) my boyfriend at the time was killed instantly. Thus the reason I have been on and off Xanax for 20 years.PTSD. For some reason I think I am going to be a big baby about this surgery. I know that I read a lot from women on these discussion boards and they say that they had little pain after their lumpectomy, but I am so sore today it is unbelievable. I just don't understand it, and am not looking forward to tomorrow. Maybe I will surprise myself and it won't be as bad as I think. I have always told myself before surgery to think that I will be in the most amount of pain I can imagine and when I wake up I tell myself "well, it's not as bad as I thought" I know that sounds strange but it has become a coping mechanism for me and seems to work. Here is a thought, maybe Monday we will both get our B9 results! (thinking positive for both of us) BTW, I know everybody is different, and I shouldn't compare myself with anybody else, but do you know if it is common to leave the hospital with a drain for a lumpectomy, and a node removal?.....Mindy

I am still praying your results come back B9. I talked to the Path lab Friday and was told that if I did not hear anything by Tuesday call back. I have my post-op checkup Thursday at 2:15, until then it's just the waiting game:( I still think it will be B9 but if not, I will stand tall,stand proud, and do whatever i have to do!
